## Description {#details}

A list of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/die">DIE</a> values.

This is a singly-linked list, but instead of reversing the order of insertion, we keep a pointer to the back of the list so we can push in order.

There are two main reasons to choose a linked list over a customized vector-like data structure.


<ul>
<li>For teardown efficiency, we want DIEs to be BumpPtrAllocated. Using a linked list here makes this way easier to accomplish.</li>
<li>Carrying an extra pointer per <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dievalue">DIEValue</a></em> isn&#39;t expensive. 45% of DIEs have 2 or fewer values, and 90% have 5 or fewer. A vector would be over-allocated by 50% on average anyway, the same cost as the linked-list node.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 689 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/die-h">DIE.h</a>.
